title: This development may fully reopen the global economy — and the stock market has mostly ignored it
text:
Will bank stocks' wild rally continue? Here are the numbers to watch in this week's earnings

Potential earnings success from Bank of America, Citi, Wells Fargo, Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase hinges on lending activity increases in the face of competition from non-banks and cautiousness from potential borrowers. See full story.

We're losing the Social Security propaganda war

Pessimism is pervasive See full story.

No, it wasn't a pilot ‘sickout': Here's what was really behind Southwest's flight disruptions over the weekend

Southwest Airlines Co.'s weekend of canceled flights was made worse by the deep cuts the airline and others had to make on their flight schedules and it is likely to add to the airline's labor strains and costs. See full story.

The hedge funds that left wildfire victims holding the bag on PG&E stock

Billionaire David Tepper and his Appaloosa Management led a group of hedge funds netting at least $2 billion by dumping PG&E stock awarded by a bankruptcy court, according to a KQED and the California Newsroom report. See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

Panera's new white bread and pasta sandwich has 860 calories and 1,650 milligrams of sodium. See full story.
